definitions.definition: take, hold, or deploy (something) as a means of accomplishing a purpose or achieving a result; employ.
examples: she used her key to open the front door
synonyms: put/press into service More"she used her key to open the front door"exercise
bring to bear "the court will use its discretion in making an order"

definitions.definition: take or consume (an amount) from a limited supply of something.
examples: we have used all the available funds

definitions.definition: exploit (a person or situation) for one's own advantage.
examples: I couldn't help feeling that she was using me
synonyms: milk; informalwalk all over "he just felt used"

examples: use your troops well and they will not let you down

definitions.definition: apply (a name or title) to oneself.
examples: she still used her maiden name professionally

definitions.definition: one would like or benefit from.
examples: I could use another cup of coffee

definitions.definition: describing an action or state of affairs that was done repeatedly or existed for a period in the past.
examples: this road used to be a dirt track

definitions.definition: be or become familiar with someone or something through experience.
examples: she was used to getting what she wanted

definitions.definition: the action of using something or the state of being used for some purpose.
examples: a member of staff is present when the pool is in use

definitions.definition: a purpose for or way in which something can be used.
